Enquire now Mahindra XUV 3XO highlights The XUV 3XO gets two petrol and one diesel engine option. The entry-level XUV 3XO gets a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI petrol engine while the higher variants come with a 1.2-liter turbo direct injection petrol. Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. About Wikipedia Disclaimers Search Mahindra XUV 3XO Article Talk Language Watch Edit The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a subcompact crossover SUV produced by the Indian automaker Mahindra & Mahindra , based on the X100 platform of Mahindra XUV300 . It has been sold in the Indian market since 29 April 2024,in mid of 2024 was also went to sale in South Africa and followed in Australia from July 2025. XUV 3XO is the facelift of the Mahindra XUV300 . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ] (S220) Mahindra XUV 3XO Overview Manufacturer Mahindra & Mahindra Model code S220 Production 2024present Assembly India: Nashik , Maharashtra Body and chassis Class Subcompact crossover SUV Bodystyle 5-door SUV Layout Front-engine, front-wheel-drive Platform X100 Platform Related Mahindra XUV300 KGM Tivoli Powertrain Engine Petrol : 1.2 L mStallion TCMPFi I3 turbo 1.2 L mStallion T-GDi I3 turbo Diesel : 1.5 L 4D15 CRDe I4 turbo Transmission 6-speed Manual 6-speed automated manual 6-speed automatic Dimensions Wheelbase 2,600mm (100in) Length 3,995mm (157.3in) Width 1,821mm (71.7in) Height 1,617mm (63.7in) Kerbweight 1,362kg (3,003lb) Contents 1 Overview 2 Specifications 3 Variants 4 Powertrain 5 Features 6 Safety 7 References 8 External links Overview edit The Mahindra XUV 3XO was introduced in April 2024 as a facelift of XUV300 model. The XUV 3XO comes with enhanced engine options, a refreshed design, and new technology features aimed at catering to the needs of both urban and off-road drivers. [ 5 ] [ 6 ] [ 7 ] Specifications edit The XUV 3XO has a seating capacity for 5 passengers and a boot space of 364 litres. It has a 42 litres (11USgal) fuel tank, and a mini spare wheel. It has a McPherson strut front suspension with an anti-roll bar, and a torsion beam suspension with coil springs in the rear. Its turning radius is 5.3 metres (17ft). Variants edit The XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants: [ 8 ] [ 9 ] [ 10 ] MX Series: Includes MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, and MX3 Pro. AX Series: Includes AX5, AX5 Luxury, AX7, and AX7 Luxury variants. REVEX Series: Includes REVX M, REVX M(O), and REVX A. The top-end variant, AX7 Luxury, features a panoramic sunroof, advanced infotainment options, and a full suite of safety features including ADAS . In Australia, only the AX5L and AX7L variants, all with the Petrol 1.2L TCMPFi engine, are available. Powertrain edit The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with three engine options, two 1.2 L turbocharged petrol three-cylinders or a 1.5 L turbodiesel four-cylinder. [ 11 ] [ 12 ] [ 13 ] The base engine is a port-injected version of the petrol three-cylinder which produces 82kW (111PS; 110hp) and 200Nm (20.4kgm; 148lbft) of torque. The diesel engine has common rail direct injection and produces 85.8kW (116.7PS; 115.1hp) and 300Nm (30.6kgm; 221lbft) of torque. The direct injected and intercooled petrol engine is only available on higher grades, and outputs 96kW (131PS; 129hp) and 230Nm (23.5kgm; 170lbft) of torque. The petrol engines are offered with a choice of 6-speed manual or an Aisin sourced 6-speed torque converter automatic transmission, while the diesel engine can be had with a 6-speed manual or a 6-speed automated manual transmission marketed as 'AutoSHIFT+'. final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: 

**Mahindra XUV 3XO: Detailed Feature Analysis**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a subcompact SUV that was launched in April 2024 as a facelift to the XUV300. It is available in multiple variants, including MX Series (MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, and MX3 Pro) and AX Series (AX5, AX5 Luxury, AX7, and AX7 Luxury). This report will cover the key features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, organized into relevant categories.

**1. Engine and Transmission**

The XUV 3XO offers three engine options:

*   **1.2L Turbo Petrol (TCMPFi):** This engine produces 82 kW (111 PS) at 5000 rpm and 200 Nm of torque at 1500-3500 rpm. It is available with a 6-speed manual or a 6-speed automatic transmission.
*   **1.2L Turbo Petrol (TGDi):** This direct-injection petrol engine produces 96 kW (130 PS) at 5000 rpm and 230 Nm of torque at 1500-3750 rpm. It is available with a 6-speed manual or a 6-speed automatic transmission.
*   **1.5L Diesel (CRDe):** This diesel engine produces 85.8 kW (117 PS) at 3750 rpm and 300 Nm of torque at 1500-2500 rpm. It is available with a 6-speed manual or a 6-speed automated manual transmission (AMT).

**Summary:** The XUV 3XO provides a range of engine options catering to different performance preferences and fuel types. The availability of manual, automatic, and AMT transmissions adds to the versatility.

**2. Dimensions and Capacity**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has the following dimensions:

*   **Length:** 3990 mm
*   **Width:** 1821 mm
*   **Height:** 1647 mm
*   **Wheelbase:** 2600 mm
*   **Boot Space:** 364 Litres
*   **Fuel Tank Capacity:** 42 Litres
*   **Turning Radius:** 5.3 meters

The vehicle has a seating capacity of 5 passengers.

**Summary:** The XUV 3XO is a compact SUV with a decent boot space for its size. Its dimensions make it suitable for urban driving, while the 42-liter fuel tank provides an adequate range.

**3. Fuel Efficiency**

The fuel efficiency of the Mahindra XUV 3XO varies depending on the engine and transmission type:

*   **1.2L Turbo Petrol (TCMPFi):** 18.89 km/L (manual), 17.96 km/L (automatic)
*   **1.2L Turbo Petrol (TGDi):** 20.1 km/L (manual), 18.2 km/L (automatic)
*   **1.5L Diesel (CRDe):** 20.6 km/L (AMT), 21.2 km/L (manual)

**Summary:** The diesel variant offers the highest fuel efficiency, while the petrol variants also provide competitive mileage figures. These numbers are ARAI-certified and may vary based on real-world driving conditions.

**4. Safety Features**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is equipped with several safety features, including:

*   Anti-lock Braking System (ABS)
*   Electronic Brakeforce Distribution (EBD)
*   Multiple Airbags (up to 6)
*   Electronic Stability Program (ESP)
*   Level 2 ADAS (on higher variants), which includes features such as forward collision warning and adaptive cruise control
*   Rear parking sensors and camera

**Summary:** The XUV 3XO prioritizes safety with a comprehensive suite of features, including advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) in the higher variants, contributing to a safer driving experience.

**5. Luxury and Comfort Features**

*Panoramic Sunroof: Available on higher variants, offering an open-air experience.
*10.25-inch Touchscreen Infotainment System: Provides seamless connectivity and entertainment options.
*Ventilated Seats: Enhance comfort, especially in hot weather conditions.
*Automatic Climate Control: Maintains a consistent cabin temperature.
*Cruise Control: Reduces driver fatigue during long drives.
*Real-Time Vehicle Tracking: Enhances vehicle security and convenience.
*Soft-Touch Materials: Used on the dashboard and door pads for a premium feel.

**Summary:** The luxury and comfort features elevate the XUV 3XO's appeal, providing a premium driving experience with advanced technology and convenience features.

**6. Additional Features**
*  Tyre Size: 205/65 R16
*  Front Suspension: MacPherson Strut suspension
*  Rear Suspension: Rear twist beam
*  Brakes Front/Rear: Disc/Disc

**Key Factors Considered:**

*   **Engine Performance:** The variety of engine options provides different performance characteristics.
*   **Safety:** The inclusion of ADAS and standard safety features ensures a safe driving experience.
*   **Comfort:** Features like automatic climate control and ventilated seats enhance the overall comfort.
*   **Dimensions:** Compact dimensions make it suitable for urban environments.
*   **Fuel Efficiency:** The fuel efficiency figures make it an economical choice.

**Recommendations:**

*   Potential buyers should consider their driving needs and preferences when selecting the engine and transmission option.
*   Prioritizing higher variants will ensure access to advanced safety and luxury features.

**Risks or Warnings:**

*   Fuel efficiency figures may vary depending on driving conditions and habits.
*   ADAS features are only available on higher variants.

In conclusion, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is a well-rounded subcompact SUV with a range of features catering to different needs and preferences. Its variety of engine options, safety features, and luxury enhancements make it a competitive option in its segment.
recommendations: Consider driving needs when selecting engine and transmission.
Prioritize higher variants for advanced safety and luxury features.
risks_or_warnings: Fuel efficiency may vary based on driving conditions.
ADAS features are limited to higher variants.

final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: The Mahindra XUV 3XO aims to provide a premium experience in the subcompact SUV segment by incorporating several luxury-oriented features focused on comfort, convenience, aesthetics, and advanced technology. Here's a detailed analysis of these features:

**1. Panoramic Sunroof:**

The XUV 3XO features a panoramic sunroof, advertised as one of the largest in its segment. This feature significantly enhances the cabin's ambiance by providing an open-air feel and increased natural light. The large glass area extends over the front and rear seats, allowing all occupants to enjoy the sky view. Operation is typically electric, with options for tilting and sliding to control the amount of sunlight entering the cabin. This feature elevates the perceived spaciousness and luxury of the vehicle’s interior.

**2. Soft-Touch Materials on Dashboard and Door Pads:**

One of the standout luxury features is the use of soft-touch materials on the dashboard and door pads. This elevates the tactile experience inside the cabin, providing a more premium feel compared to hard plastic surfaces commonly found in this segment. These materials are generally more pleasant to touch and contribute to a sense of higher quality and refinement. The specific type of soft-touch material (e.g., leatherette, padded fabric) may vary by trim level, but its inclusion represents a conscious effort to enhance the interior's perceived luxury.

**3. Level 2 ADAS (Advanced Driver-Assistance Systems):**

The XUV 3XO incorporates Level 2 ADAS, offering a suite of advanced safety and convenience features. These systems use sensors, cameras, and radar to assist the driver and enhance safety. Key features typically include:

*   **Forward Collision Warning (FCW):** Alerts the driver to potential frontal collisions.
*   **Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB):** Automatically applies the brakes to mitigate or avoid collisions.
*   **Lane Departure Warning (LDW):** Warns the driver if the vehicle drifts out of its lane.
*   **Lane Keep Assist (LKA):** Provides steering assistance to keep the vehicle within its lane.
*   **Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC):** Automatically adjusts the vehicle’s speed to maintain a safe distance from the vehicle ahead.
*   **Traffic Sign Recognition (TSR):** Detects and displays traffic signs, such as speed limits.

These ADAS features not only enhance safety but also contribute to a more relaxed and convenient driving experience, which aligns with luxury vehicle expectations.

**4. Advanced Infotainment System:**

The XUV 3XO is equipped with a modern infotainment system that includes a large touchscreen display (typically 10.25 inches). This system offers several luxury and convenience features:

*   **High-Resolution Display:** Provides crisp and clear visuals for navigation, media, and vehicle information.
*   **Touchscreen Interface:** Offers intuitive control over various vehicle functions.
*   **Smartphone Integration:** Supports Apple CarPlay and Android Auto for seamless smartphone connectivity.
*   **Connected Car Features:** Includes features such as remote vehicle monitoring, geofencing, and emergency assistance.
*   **Premium Audio System:** Higher trims may feature a branded premium audio system (e.g., from Harman Kardon or Sony) with enhanced sound quality and multiple speakers.

**5. Ventilated Seats:**

Ventilated seats, available in higher trims, provide enhanced comfort, especially in hot weather conditions. These seats incorporate fans that circulate air through the seat cushions, keeping occupants cool and dry. This feature is a significant comfort upgrade, particularly for long drives or in warm climates.

**6. Dual-Zone Automatic Climate Control:**

Dual-zone automatic climate control allows the driver and front passenger to set their preferred temperatures independently. This ensures that both occupants can enjoy a comfortable environment without compromise. This feature adds to the overall convenience and luxury of the cabin.

**7. Premium Upholstery:**

The use of premium upholstery, such as leatherette or high-quality fabric, enhances the interior's aesthetic appeal and comfort. The specific type of upholstery may vary by trim level, but the focus is on providing a more luxurious feel compared to standard cloth seats. This feature contributes significantly to the overall sense of refinement inside the vehicle.

**8. Refined and Robust Exterior Design:**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO boasts a refined exterior design, which, although subjective, plays a role in the overall luxury perception. The vehicle features:

*   **LED Lighting:** LED headlights, taillights, and daytime running lights provide a modern and premium look.
*   **Stylish Alloy Wheels:** Alloy wheels are available in various designs and sizes, enhancing the vehicle's aesthetic appeal.
*   **Chrome Accents:** Chrome accents on the exterior (e.g., grille, door handles) add a touch of elegance.


In summary, the Mahindra XUV 3XO integrates a range of luxury features designed to enhance comfort, convenience, aesthetics, and safety, positioning it as a competitive option in the subcompact SUV market.
recommendations: Further research into specific trim levels is necessary to determine the exact availability of each luxury feature.
Comparative analysis with competing models in the same segment would provide additional context on the XUV 3XO's luxury offerings.
risks_or_warnings: Feature availability may vary by region and trim level. Always verify specifications with the manufacturer.
Descriptions are based on currently available information and may be subject to change.

Enquire now Mahindra XUV 3XO highlights The XUV 3XO gets two petrol and one diesel engine option. The entry-level XUV 3XO gets a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI petrol engine while the higher variants come with a 1.2-liter turbo direct injection petrol. Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. About Wikipedia Disclaimers Search Mahindra XUV 3XO Article Talk Language Watch Edit The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a subcompact crossover SUV produced by the Indian automaker Mahindra & Mahindra , based on the X100 platform of Mahindra XUV300 . It has been sold in the Indian market since 29 April 2024,in mid of 2024 was also went to sale in South Africa and followed in Australia from July 2025. XUV 3XO is the facelift of the Mahindra XUV300 . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ] (S220) Mahindra XUV 3XO Overview Manufacturer Mahindra & Mahindra Model code S220 Production 2024present Assembly India: Nashik , Maharashtra Body and chassis Class Subcompact crossover SUV Bodystyle 5-door SUV Layout Front-engine, front-wheel-drive Platform X100 Platform Related Mahindra XUV300 KGM Tivoli Powertrain Engine Petrol : 1.2 L mStallion TCMPFi I3 turbo 1.2 L mStallion T-GDi I3 turbo Diesel : 1.5 L 4D15 CRDe I4 turbo Transmission 6-speed Manual 6-speed automated manual 6-speed automatic Dimensions Wheelbase 2,600mm (100in) Length 3,995mm (157.3in) Width 1,821mm (71.7in) Height 1,617mm (63.7in) Kerbweight 1,362kg (3,003lb) Contents 1 Overview 2 Specifications 3 Variants 4 Powertrain 5 Features 6 Safety 7 References 8 External links Overview edit The Mahindra XUV 3XO was introduced in April 2024 as a facelift of XUV300 model. The XUV 3XO comes with enhanced engine options, a refreshed design, and new technology features aimed at catering to the needs of both urban and off-road drivers. [ 5 ] [ 6 ] [ 7 ] Specifications edit The XUV 3XO has a seating capacity for 5 passengers and a boot space of 364 litres. It has a 42 litres (11USgal) fuel tank, and a mini spare wheel. It has a McPherson strut front suspension with an anti-roll bar, and a torsion beam suspension with coil springs in the rear. Its turning radius is 5.3 metres (17ft). Variants edit The XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants: [ 8 ] [ 9 ] [ 10 ] MX Series: Includes MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, and MX3 Pro. AX Series: Includes AX5, AX5 Luxury, AX7, and AX7 Luxury variants. REVEX Series: Includes REVX M, REVX M(O), and REVX A. The top-end variant, AX7 Luxury, features a panoramic sunroof, advanced infotainment options, and a full suite of safety features including ADAS . In Australia, only the AX5L and AX7L variants, all with the Petrol 1.2L TCMPFi engine, are available. Powertrain edit The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with three engine options, two 1.2 L turbocharged petrol three-cylinders or a 1.5 L turbodiesel four-cylinder. [ 11 ] [ 12 ] [ 13 ] The base engine is a port-injected version of the petrol three-cylinder which produces 82kW (111PS; 110hp) and 200Nm (20.4kgm; 148lbft) of torque. The diesel engine has common rail direct injection and produces 85.8kW (116.7PS; 115.1hp) and 300Nm (30.6kgm; 221lbft) of torque. The direct injected and intercooled petrol engine is only available on higher grades, and outputs 96kW (131PS; 129hp) and 230Nm (23.5kgm; 170lbft) of torque. The petrol engines are offered with a choice of 6-speed manual or an Aisin sourced 6-speed torque converter automatic transmission, while the diesel engine can be had with a 6-speed manual or a 6-speed automated manual transmission marketed as 'AutoSHIFT+'. final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: 

**Mahindra XUV 3XO: Detailed Feature Analysis**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a subcompact SUV that was launched in April 2024 as a facelift to the XUV300. It is available in multiple variants, including MX Series (MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, and MX3 Pro) and AX Series (AX5, AX5 Luxury, AX7, and AX7 Luxury). This report will cover the key features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, organized into relevant categories.

**1. Engine and Transmission**

The XUV 3XO offers three engine options:

*   **1.2L Turbo Petrol (TCMPFi):** This engine produces 82 kW (111 PS) at 5000 rpm and 200 Nm of torque at 1500-3500 rpm. It is available with a 6-speed manual or a 6-speed automatic transmission.
*   **1.2L Turbo Petrol (TGDi):** This direct-injection petrol engine produces 96 kW (130 PS) at 5000 rpm and 230 Nm of torque at 1500-3750 rpm. It is available with a 6-speed manual or a 6-speed automatic transmission.
*   **1.5L Diesel (CRDe):** This diesel engine produces 85.8 kW (117 PS) at 3750 rpm and 300 Nm of torque at 1500-2500 rpm. It is available with a 6-speed manual or a 6-speed automated manual transmission (AMT).

**Summary:** The XUV 3XO provides a range of engine options catering to different performance preferences and fuel types. The availability of manual, automatic, and AMT transmissions adds to the versatility.

**2. Dimensions and Capacity**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has the following dimensions:

*   **Length:** 3990 mm
*   **Width:** 1821 mm
*   **Height:** 1647 mm
*   **Wheelbase:** 2600 mm
*   **Boot Space:** 364 Litres
*   **Fuel Tank Capacity:** 42 Litres
*   **Turning Radius:** 5.3 meters

The vehicle has a seating capacity of 5 passengers.

**Summary:** The XUV 3XO is a compact SUV with a decent boot space for its size. Its dimensions make it suitable for urban driving, while the 42-liter fuel tank provides an adequate range.

**3. Fuel Efficiency**

The fuel efficiency of the Mahindra XUV 3XO varies depending on the engine and transmission type:

*   **1.2L Turbo Petrol (TCMPFi):** 18.89 km/L (manual), 17.96 km/L (automatic)
*   **1.2L Turbo Petrol (TGDi):** 20.1 km/L (manual), 18.2 km/L (automatic)
*   **1.5L Diesel (CRDe):** 20.6 km/L (AMT), 21.2 km/L (manual)

**Summary:** The diesel variant offers the highest fuel efficiency, while the petrol variants also provide competitive mileage figures. These numbers are ARAI-certified and may vary based on real-world driving conditions.

**4. Safety Features**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is equipped with several safety features, including:

*   Anti-lock Braking System (ABS)
*   Electronic Brakeforce Distribution (EBD)
*   Multiple Airbags (up to 6)
*   Electronic Stability Program (ESP)
*   Level 2 ADAS (on higher variants), which includes features such as forward collision warning and adaptive cruise control
*   Rear parking sensors and camera

**Summary:** The XUV 3XO prioritizes safety with a comprehensive suite of features, including advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) in the higher variants, contributing to a safer driving experience.

**5. Luxury and Comfort Features**

*Panoramic Sunroof: Available on higher variants, offering an open-air experience.
*10.25-inch Touchscreen Infotainment System: Provides seamless connectivity and entertainment options.
*Ventilated Seats: Enhance comfort, especially in hot weather conditions.
*Automatic Climate Control: Maintains a consistent cabin temperature.
*Cruise Control: Reduces driver fatigue during long drives.
*Real-Time Vehicle Tracking: Enhances vehicle security and convenience.
*Soft-Touch Materials: Used on the dashboard and door pads for a premium feel.

**Summary:** The luxury and comfort features elevate the XUV 3XO's appeal, providing a premium driving experience with advanced technology and convenience features.

**6. Additional Features**
*  Tyre Size: 205/65 R16
*  Front Suspension: MacPherson Strut suspension
*  Rear Suspension: Rear twist beam
*  Brakes Front/Rear: Disc/Disc

**Key Factors Considered:**

*   **Engine Performance:** The variety of engine options provides different performance characteristics.
*   **Safety:** The inclusion of ADAS and standard safety features ensures a safe driving experience.
*   **Comfort:** Features like automatic climate control and ventilated seats enhance the overall comfort.
*   **Dimensions:** Compact dimensions make it suitable for urban environments.
*   **Fuel Efficiency:** The fuel efficiency figures make it an economical choice.

**Recommendations:**

*   Potential buyers should consider their driving needs and preferences when selecting the engine and transmission option.
*   Prioritizing higher variants will ensure access to advanced safety and luxury features.

**Risks or Warnings:**

*   Fuel efficiency figures may vary depending on driving conditions and habits.
*   ADAS features are only available on higher variants.

In conclusion, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is a well-rounded subcompact SUV with a range of features catering to different needs and preferences. Its variety of engine options, safety features, and luxury enhancements make it a competitive option in its segment.
recommendations: Consider driving needs when selecting engine and transmission.
Prioritize higher variants for advanced safety and luxury features.
risks_or_warnings: Fuel efficiency may vary based on driving conditions.
ADAS features are limited to higher variants.

final_report.summary: Mahindra XUV 3XO offers luxury features like panoramic sunroof, soft-touch dashboard, Level 2 ADAS, and a powerful turbo-petrol engine.
final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: The Mahindra XUV 3XO aims to provide a premium experience in the subcompact SUV segment by incorporating several luxury-oriented features focused on comfort, convenience, aesthetics, and advanced technology. Here's a detailed analysis of these features:

**1. Panoramic Sunroof:**

The XUV 3XO features a panoramic sunroof, advertised as one of the largest in its segment. This feature significantly enhances the cabin's ambiance by providing an open-air feel and increased natural light. The large glass area extends over the front and rear seats, allowing all occupants to enjoy the sky view. Operation is typically electric, with options for tilting and sliding to control the amount of sunlight entering the cabin. This feature elevates the perceived spaciousness and luxury of the vehicle’s interior.

**2. Soft-Touch Materials on Dashboard and Door Pads:**

One of the standout luxury features is the use of soft-touch materials on the dashboard and door pads. This elevates the tactile experience inside the cabin, providing a more premium feel compared to hard plastic surfaces commonly found in this segment. These materials are generally more pleasant to touch and contribute to a sense of higher quality and refinement. The specific type of soft-touch material (e.g., leatherette, padded fabric) may vary by trim level, but its inclusion represents a conscious effort to enhance the interior's perceived luxury.

**3. Level 2 ADAS (Advanced Driver-Assistance Systems):**

The XUV 3XO incorporates Level 2 ADAS, offering a suite of advanced safety and convenience features. These systems use sensors, cameras, and radar to assist the driver and enhance safety. Key features typically include:

*   **Forward Collision Warning (FCW):** Alerts the driver to potential frontal collisions.
*   **Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB):** Automatically applies the brakes to mitigate or avoid collisions.
*   **Lane Departure Warning (LDW):** Warns the driver if the vehicle drifts out of its lane.
*   **Lane Keep Assist (LKA):** Provides steering assistance to keep the vehicle within its lane.
*   **Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC):** Automatically adjusts the vehicle’s speed to maintain a safe distance from the vehicle ahead.
*   **Traffic Sign Recognition (TSR):** Detects and displays traffic signs, such as speed limits.

These ADAS features not only enhance safety but also contribute to a more relaxed and convenient driving experience, which aligns with luxury vehicle expectations.

**4. Advanced Infotainment System:**

The XUV 3XO is equipped with a modern infotainment system that includes a large touchscreen display (typically 10.25 inches). This system offers several luxury and convenience features:

*   **High-Resolution Display:** Provides crisp and clear visuals for navigation, media, and vehicle information.
*   **Touchscreen Interface:** Offers intuitive control over various vehicle functions.
*   **Smartphone Integration:** Supports Apple CarPlay and Android Auto for seamless smartphone connectivity.
*   **Connected Car Features:** Includes features such as remote vehicle monitoring, geofencing, and emergency assistance.
*   **Premium Audio System:** Higher trims may feature a branded premium audio system (e.g., from Harman Kardon or Sony) with enhanced sound quality and multiple speakers.

**5. Ventilated Seats:**

Ventilated seats, available in higher trims, provide enhanced comfort, especially in hot weather conditions. These seats incorporate fans that circulate air through the seat cushions, keeping occupants cool and dry. This feature is a significant comfort upgrade, particularly for long drives or in warm climates.

**6. Dual-Zone Automatic Climate Control:**

Dual-zone automatic climate control allows the driver and front passenger to set their preferred temperatures independently. This ensures that both occupants can enjoy a comfortable environment without compromise. This feature adds to the overall convenience and luxury of the cabin.

**7. Premium Upholstery:**

The use of premium upholstery, such as leatherette or high-quality fabric, enhances the interior's aesthetic appeal and comfort. The specific type of upholstery may vary by trim level, but the focus is on providing a more luxurious feel compared to standard cloth seats. This feature contributes significantly to the overall sense of refinement inside the vehicle.

**8. Refined and Robust Exterior Design:**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO boasts a refined exterior design, which, although subjective, plays a role in the overall luxury perception. The vehicle features:

*   **LED Lighting:** LED headlights, taillights, and daytime running lights provide a modern and premium look.
*   **Stylish Alloy Wheels:** Alloy wheels are available in various designs and sizes, enhancing the vehicle's aesthetic appeal.
*   **Chrome Accents:** Chrome accents on the exterior (e.g., grille, door handles) add a touch of elegance.


In summary, the Mahindra XUV 3XO integrates a range of luxury features designed to enhance comfort, convenience, aesthetics, and safety, positioning it as a competitive option in the subcompact SUV market.
recommendations: Further research into specific trim levels is necessary to determine the exact availability of each luxury feature.
Comparative analysis with competing models in the same segment would provide additional context on the XUV 3XO's luxury offerings.
risks_or_warnings: Feature availability may vary by region and trim level. Always verify specifications with the manufacturer.
Descriptions are based on currently available information and may be subject to change.
